intro: Thesium setulosum, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stem and narrow, linear leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or orange, with three petals and three sepals. Thesium setulosum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
